title: Will there be Tristana buffs/changes in patch 7.3?
body: She's been left in the dust for a while and I feel uncomfortable if she's trash. She isn't, imo, but if my teammates think that, they're probably not going try as much.

replies.body: There might be. We're testing some buffs to her AS/level and Q CD. Those wouldn't solve some of the bigger issues she's got (gameplay identity isn't sufficiently defined) but would hopefully put her in a better position until that could be looked at. She is a champ we're cautious with though, given lack of tuning levers can mean she's underperforming or must pick.

List of buffs you might consider:

1. AS/level (you might reduce AS-10%- from Q and give tonz of AS/level - 1.5% to 3%)
2. Increase in duration of Q (ex> 5 to 7)
3. Increase in passive range (ex> 7 to 8+)
4. Applying CC after Trist lands on after her jump (jump won't be canceled)


In my opinion, Trist should have her own characteristics and those are "Man vs Wild" (survivability; #4), turret-destroyer(#2,3)  and hyper-carry(#2,3).

By increasing duration of Q instead of reducing CD of Q, CDR will be more beneficial stat/item to Trist and it will enhance her ability to destroy turrets as designed to be.

I feel that it would be easier to balance by adding utility to her kit such as a slow on her e. Or making her ult stun target into the wall for a set period of time. It would make it easier overall to balance.  Another way is adding bonus AD ratio to her ult adding Physical current % hp damage on her ult as a passive ect.

We've been talking about those sort of options. Before doing those sort of changes though we want to identify a direction we want to take Trist in overall to ensure any buffs are compatible with her long term state (how much should she be focused on early tower taking, versus being a reset marksman, versus hypercarry, versus risk take who goes into the middle of fights etc).

And tower pushers with Caitlyn, Jinx and Ziggs in the bot lane. As we currently only have 1 diving type of marksmen with graves but isn't really played bot, but anyway thank you for the information.

With the amount of hours I have logged onto the champion, I have to say that I really hate the idea of making her a _"diving ADC"_ which is a concept that goes completely against her passive, which rewards her the longer the game goes by **keeping her distance** and using her resets to either clean fights, or more often than not, self-peel like no other ADC.

She had no _"identity crisis"_ till Riot made it up. She's the best late game self-peel hyper carry. It's a very simple concept.
Why would you want to strip her of an identity she has had since the inception of this game in favor of a play-style that goes against her design?

I'm kinda puzzled about the whole 'identity crisis' thing myself.

Before Riot reworked her, she was the safest hyper-carry though she had the lowest damage.  Vayne was the riskiest, though with the best single target damage.  Twitch had the best positioning tool with massive AoE damage thrown in.

Adding in the whole tower taking thing while crushing both her range and her attack speed seemed completely silly to me.

The traditional hypercarries:

{{champion:222}} Resets from kills to clean fights, AOE damage, decent laning phase.
{{champion:29}} Positioning tool from stealth and long range AOE damage.
{{champion:96}} The mobile tower. Play Tower Defense and he'll win fights for you.
{{champion:67}} Rewards mechanics and risk taking. Best dueling ADC in the right hands.
{{champion:18}} Best self peel. Jump/Ult best used for that end while her passive gives her great range.

_Note: **All of them** are great taking towers if given time to hammer on them in the late game.
_

Trist had a clear identity. This whole situation is frustrating and makes me sad.
Look at the lore story they wrote for her. She jumps and remains safe by herself while fighting the thieves. That's her...

>he's the best late game self-peel hyper carry. It's a very simple concept.

She's bursty, resetting, a strong kiter with her scaling AA range, a waveclearing turret pusher, a self-peeler, a hyper carry, etc. with both strong single target and AoE damage. When she's good she can essentially do everything except poke.

**Bursty**: She needs to build the **Explosive Charge** to do any damage, gating the amount of damage she can do to how well she's positioned and how many autos she can get. After that, the skill is on a very long cooldown. You speak of it as if it was always available and Annie-levels of constant.

**Resetting**: You want to use your jump to remain safe, not jump into 3 people hoping you may get a reset to get out of there. You are not Katarina. Or if you wanna chase kills to clean a fight, but that happens only when the fight is already won.

**Strong kiter with scaling AA range**: Yes. This is part of that late game power that makes her identity.

**Waveclearing Turret Pusher**: Only in the later stages of the game. In lane, you are forced to always push, making it super easy for a lane bully to zone you away from a wave and deny you fram simply because you can't trade as Trist with a lane bully. Your job in lane is to farm, but the E's passive forces you to always push. As for **Turret Pushing**, I'm sorry but any of the above mentioned carries can destroy towers really fast if given 10 seconds to hammer them down. It's not exclusive to Trist's **Explosive Charge** nor is it her identity.

**Self peeling hypercarry**: Her identity. That's it.

**Strong Single Target and AoE Damage**: You are heavily overestimating what her AoE can do. Do you know why Rageblade was a great purchase for her prior to the item's rework? Because it provided you with that AoE that you naturally don't have. **Explosive Charge** needs stacks and it's on a long cooldown. That's not a _"super strong" AoE damage source_.

You can't speak of all her skills without going down to the details, because it's very easy to make any champion sound better than what they are if you do that.

All you've managed to do is state that her strengths are mediocre, not debate whether or not she has them. And just like Meddler said, she does too much right now, even if she isn't the best at any particular thing.

>how many autos she can get

Explosive charge can be stacked with spells and she can also cast and auto mid air, fyi.

I know spells stack the charge, you are missing the point: You need stacks to have the explosive charge do any kind of damage. Also, jumping or using the ult to give** Explosive Charge** a charge is a heavy miss use of those skills.

In a realistic team fight scenario, you'll grab stacks first and foremost with your autos, not your spells, which should be kept for self peel. You may have a problem if you can't understand that.

My statement doesn't change: It's based around how many autos you can get. Spell stacking is not your primary source of stacking as those spells are primary tools for self peel above anything else. I don't think you understand the champion if you fail to understand such a simple concept.

**Dear Meddler:** I've been trying to reach out for months now. I just want to drop my two cents. I care a lot about Tristana, I really do. I keep grinding large amounts of mastery points because I find her fun and I love her character. 

To me (and many others), her gameplay identity is simple: **The best self peeling late game hyper carry**
Everything else, **including tower-taking**, should be **secondary** to her. Please do **not** lose focus on this very simple concept.

I don't feel tower-taking should be her core, because her kit just isn't built around sieges, laning or split pushing, rather team fighting and scaling. She has a weak laning phase, which I don't mind but it's just counter-intuitive to want to base her around taking towers when she can't even start doing it effectively before the 25th min mark. Taking towers should be a bonus (if at all present), not her identity, even more when her passive is thought out and designed to make her a powerhouse in the late game specifically. If you're going to change all of that, then the champion might as well not even be Tristana anymore and you should just make a new character.

I asked Scarizard during a live Q & A on Twitch about Tristana, and he told me you guys didn't know what to do with her. That was about 7 to 9 months ago, and it was the only time a rioter talked about Trist last year.

What I'm most sad about is not her being untouched for over a year, but rather the lack of communication and apparent apathy or negligence I sense from Riot towards the champion. Or maybe you just don't know her anymore. I've come to learn how Aatrox fans feel.

I wanted to share some ideas I've had for her for a while now. Please note that I don't mean any of these as _"Do them all"_ but rather _"Think about each one"_ and I just share them in case you guy may have missed them when talking about Trist.

**QOL Improvements to Rocket Jump**
- Make it uninterruptible. She can take damage while flying, but let her always complete her jump. This I feel would do wonders for her without touching anything else on her kit.
- Streamline how the skill works with CC. It's really frustrating to have something that looks like a jump (we know it's a dash) to be interrupted mid air by ground-based CC. It's really counter intuitive, creates really awkward situations and takes away from the "Jumping around" fantasy you seem to want for her.
- Have her cast animation be faster
- Have her travel speed be faster

**Other QOL Improvements**
- Improve her AA animation. One person in another thread pointed out how her autos are somewhat clunky, and at times feel really easy to cancel by accident. This would make her kiting better, further playing to the late game self-peeling identity I talked about before.
- Don't have **Explosive Charge** go on cooldown if the target dies before the bomb is palced on them, which cancels the animation, the damage, but does make the skill go on cooldown and it can be a frustrating problem.

**Other Ideas**
The game is in a state where it's important for an ADC to be able to become relevant with two and sometimes one item (BF+Runnan's for example). Trist right now reminds me of the old Gangplank, who needed about 30 mins to just get going. The old Rageblade solved many of her problems, helping her with her slow scaling and terrible base ASPD, but that's gone.

I don't mind her weak laning phase, that's fine. But if the game around her has become so explosive and fast, you need to give her something that lets her compete at 20 - 25 mins, or slow down the overall pace of the game... but that's a whole different topic probably much harder to do at this time.

About her resets: You shouldn't treat her the way you do Kah or Katarina. Her resets are mostly used to either clean fights or do that awesome self peel she can do, rather than jumping into a high risk situation just hoping to get a reset. Please **do not** turn her into a _"Dive ADC"_ as that's completely counter-intuitive to her passive, which rewards her from keeping her distance and then combines that with her jump to, again: Keep her safe as the best self-peel late game hypercarry.

Finally, a really crazy idea: Viktor has an item unique to him. Would it be too much of a stretch to think of giving her Boomer as an actual item that scales with her and fulfilling some of the things the old Rageblade would do on her? Thematically I think is not too crazy. Her lore presents her with this line: _"For Trist and her gun, Boomer, every mission is a chance to prove that heroes do exist" and it would tie nicely with her passive too. (It would even make sense for Riggle getting stronger)

This identity crisis you speak of, I feel did not existe prior to her rework, and only became apparent when you guys tried to give too much importance to the tower taking aspect of her kit, which I think has come to the point of just holding her back and colliding with what everyone have always looked her as: **The best self peeling late game hyper carry**
I think even Forg1ven or DoubleLift called her something like that at some point. Don't strive away from that. It's who she is.

Do not create problems where there were non. She has a clear identity, now work towards that.

I'm sad it has taken Riot this long to say anything about her, other than how nice Scarizard was that day with me answering my questions.

Anyway. I'm just one player. But the main reason I still play is this champion. I can't remain silent.
Have a nice day.

I love tristana for various reasons but I think her original theme got really washed out during her update, her range until lvl 12 or so is simply so low that you barely even remember that she's supposed to be a long range adc, of course I understand that Tristana's everything spikes super hard when she starts getting some real range but I think the early levels should be a little bit more forgiving, both Cait and Jinx have their super long range and all you can do in lane is push by mistake and miss cs because everyone outranges you :S

Also, _"early tower taking on Tristana"_?? No wonder you are so lost with her.

The champion is weak in lane because she's meant to become stronger in the late game. She doesn't stand a chance against lane bullies and she shouldn't. She's weak in lane and that's perfectly acceptable. I don't play lane thinking I should trade all the time and take a tower early. I play my lane focusing on farm so I can get to my important items ASAP so I can be effective in team fights because that's what her kit encourages me to do. There's another ADC player that agrees that's the right way of playing her. His name is Forg1ven.

If you want to make an ADC specialized on taking towers early, then put that into a new lane bully ADC. You gave her this identity crisis by giving her a mechanic that goes against her pasive, her theme and her history.

You're looking at tristana in a vacuum. Her DPS and AoE are nowhere near as high as other marksmen. Her E is not a poke spell and never was. That's not what a poke spell is at all. A poke spell is a spell one can cast from a long range to safely deal considerable damage from a distance. Jayce EQ, nidalee Q, varus Q, Caitlyn Q, xerath Q, jinx W are all poke spells.

Jinx and twitch beat her in DPS early and late game, while vayne and kog beat her out solely late.

Her AoE is abysmal compared to twitch and jinx in fights. Her E radius is small as fuck ( 75 on a champion).

Tristana's strengths are meant to be super fast tower killing and safety+ reset mechanic for cleaning up fights. She's one of the safest marksmen in the game with her ult and W. The only problem comes when her Q is on an extremely long cd so if she uses it and gets cced or can't attack anything her DPS drops like a rock afterward.

Ezreal's dash is much faster and is usually maxed 2nd with 13 seconds at max with builds that easily get him 30-40% CDR which would put his dash's CD down to like 8 seconds and then be decreased by 1.5 seconds for every Q you land. You will see Ezreal use his Arcane shift more often in a team fight than Tristana's jump UNLESS the fight was so in Tristana's teams favor that it probably wouldn't matter. As a Koggers main, I'm in a similar spot.

Well, at least as far as the whole 'Riot doesn't know what this champ does' side of things.

See, Kog has always been a mid-game focused Marksmen.  That was true back when he built Bloodrazor, it was true when he built Trinity into Bork.  Along with Trist, he was a bit too strong when Bloothrister got remade and all the lane bullies got nerfed as a result.  The old Trinity (into IE and a pair of PDs) gave him a pretty great late game to boot.  100% crit chance?  Not shabby.  But that was a bit of an outlier.  Kog has always been the go-to guy for really kicking it Mid-Game and scaling from there.

But Riot seemed *convinced* that he was supposed to be a late game hyper-scaler like Twitch or Vayne.  His success curve really hasn't ever been like that.  He has *always* leveled off (or even dropped) in the deep late game.  So when Riot flipped out over Kog being strong mid-game with the whole machine gun fiasco, I was pretty puzzled.  Especially since they shifted his power from late game (no base damage W with AD scaling) to early/mid (2% + 20 base damage W and no AD ratio) and were apparently shocked when that made his early/mid really strong.

I've got a bit more hope that they're have figured out that Kog needs to kick in mid-game for the whole 'main damage source for your team' thing to work since they improved his W base damage.  Even if that... probably wasn't the best way to buff him.

I feel like Riot really needs to get in touch with the main players of champs when making changes like these.  People who have hundreds, if not thousands of games logged on a champion and who know their nuances.  Because while a change like what they did to Trist's range and attack speed might not seem super important to someone who was only passingly familiar with what made old Trist work, to any veteran player it's obvious that those changes watered down her identity significantly.

Probuilds has a total of 18 {{champion:18}} games in the past **month**, one of which (Stixxay) actually has {{item:3094}} as first zeal item. Pros simply aren't playing a lot of her because she's currently perceived as weak amongst ADCs. That means they're also not bothering to optimize her builds.

{{item:3085}} is perfectly acceptable on her as a first zeal item, and pros are used to that itemization path for other hyper carries like {{champion:22}}  and {{champion:51}}, which are both highly picked in the current meta.

That being said, she doesn't currently have the same team fight impact as those two (hence her lower priority on ADC power lists) and ends up doing better in cleanup scenarios after sitting back and focusing the frontline during the fight. Her power during a fight comes from stacking E, not hitting multiple targets with on-hit procs.

When it comes to Runaan's, Cait benefits from higher headshot proc rates, while Ashe gets a slow on everyone. Twitch gets poison stacks. Most others who get it do so to compensate for poor wave clear, but Trist already has wave clear built into her kit and she doesn't gain any additional utility from it. Simply saying "there's nothing wrong with more wave clear" merely excuses the redundancy and ignores the loss of additional power (and potentially range -- a big early/mid weakness for Trist) that makes it mediocre compared to {{item:2015}} items on her. Workable, but mediocre.

I'm only making this case because I made the switch personally. Getting your zeal item feels way more impactful with the additional burst/range, allowing for better trades and objective control. Her team fighting is going to be pretty bland in mid-game no matter what zeal item you get, but the burst helps wear down whatever front line champ you're focusing better and makes for more reliable cleanup.
